Pre-Game Insights: The St. Louis Cardinals and the Milwaukee Brewers meet Tuesday in MLB action from American Family Field.
This will be the second installment in a three-game series.
Aaron Civale will start for the Brewers on Tuesday. This season Civale is 5-8 with a 4.59 ERA in 26 starts.
Sonny Gray will start for the Cardinals on Tuesday. This year Gray is 12-9 with a 3.96 ERA in 25 starts.
Each of the Cardinals' last four road games has gone OVER the total run line.
Four of the last five games between the Cardinals and Brewers at American Family Field have gone OVER the total runs line.
The 'Inning 1 UNDER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Brewers' last five night games against NL Central opponents.
The 'Inning 1 OVER 0.5 runs' market has hit in each of the Cardinals' last three games as underdogs against National League opponents.
Willy Adames has recorded at least one hit in each of the Brewers' last 10 games as favorites.
Blake Perkins has recorded at least one Single in 10 of his last 11 appearances in night games.
Christian Yelich has scored at least one run in each of his last six appearances against the Cardinals at American Family Field.
Jackson Chourio has recorded at least one RBI in each of the Brewers' last six home games against NL opponents.
Aaron Civale has recorded a win in each of his last three appearances at American Family Field.
Willy Adames has recorded at least one total base in each of the Brewers' last 10 games as favorites.
Willy Adames has hit a home run in each of the Brewers' last five games against NL opponents.
Nolan Arenado has hit a home run in two of the Cardinals' last three night games against NL Central opponents that held a winning record.
Paul Goldschmidt has recorded at least one RBI in each of the Cardinals' last four night games.
Paul Goldschmidt has recorded at least one Double in each of the Cardinals' last five games.
Lars Nootbaar has recorded at least one hit in each of the Cardinals' last nine games as underdogs.
Masyn Winn has recorded at least one Single in eight of the Cardinals' last nine night games against opponents that held a winning record.
Masyn Winn has scored at least one run in six of the Cardinals' last seven night games against NL opponents that held a winning record.
